tfse
  • Reference

map_

maps function and returns list

maps function and returns character vector

maps function and returns double vector

maps function and returns integer vector

maps function and returns logical vector

map_(f, ...)

map_chr_(f, ...)

map_dbl_(f, ...)

map_int_(f, ...)

map_lgl_(f, ...)

Arguments

f

Function
...

Other args passed to function, i.e., named parameters specific to f function, and also the MoreArgs argument from mapply.
f

Function
...

Other args passed to function, i.e., named parameters specific to f function, and also the MoreArgs argument from mapply.
f

Function
...

Other args passed to function, i.e., named parameters specific to f function, and also the MoreArgs argument from mapply.
f

Function
...

Other args passed to function, i.e., named parameters specific to f function, and also the MoreArgs argument from mapply.
f

Function
...

Other args passed to function, i.e., named parameters specific to f function, and also the MoreArgs argument from mapply.

Value

List

Vector type character

Vector type double

Vector type integer

Vector type logical.

Details

Yes, this is identical to base Map but it also hardwires USE.NAMES to FALSE.

Examples

map_(mtcars, as.data.frame)
#> Error in get(as.character(FUN), mode = "function", envir = envir): object 'mtcars' of mode 'function' was not found
x <- c("A", "brown", "car", "drove", "eighty", "four", "gallons", "how")
map_chr_(function(x) substr(x, 1, 1), x)
#> [1] "A" "b" "c" "d" "e" "f" "g" "h"
x <- rnorm(10)
map_dbl_(round, x, 2)
#>  [1] -0.87  0.11 -0.59 -0.33 -0.09 -2.05  0.15 -0.29  0.25 -0.55
x <- rnorm(10, 100, 5)
map_int_(as.integer, x, 2)
#>  [1] 107  96  92  94 105  96 104  99 104  96
map_lgl_(is.numeric, list(rnorm(10), rnorm(10)))
#> [1] TRUE TRUE
